text: Todtnau is a town in Lörrach in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. In 2020, 4,823 people lived there. == Geography == It is in the Black Forest, on the river Wiese, 20 km southeast of Freiburg. The municipality has 8 districts (Ortsteil): * Aftersteg * Brandenberg * Geschwend * Herrenschwand * Muggenbrunn * Präg * Schlechtnau * Todtnauberg == Personalities == * Karl Nessler (1872–1951), inventor of the permanent wave was born here. * Martin Heidegger (1889–1976), had a chalet in Todtnauberg == Gallery == File:Todtnauer Wasserfall 2.jpg|Todtnau waterfall File:Todtnau-Geschwend, Kirche St. Wendelin.jpg|Geschwend, church (die Sankt Wendelinkirche) in the street File:Todtnauberg 01 retouched.jpg|Panoramic view of Todtnauberg File:Todtnau, die Sankt Johannes der Täuferkirche positie2 foto3 2013-07-26 10.03.jpg|Todtnau, church: die Sankt Johannes der Täuferkirche File:Schlechtnau, kapel in straatzicht foto6 2013-07-26 10.33.jpg|Schlechtnau, chapel in the street File:Muggenbrunn, die Sankt Cornelius Kirche in straatzicht foto2 2013-07-25 16.36.jpg|Muggenbrunn, church (die Sankt Cornelius Kirche) in the street File:Aftersteg, die Sankt Anna Kirche foto1 2013-07-25 17.07.jpg|Aftersteg, church: die Sankt Anna Kirche == References == == Other websites == * www.todtnau.de Todtnau official website * Information about and images Category:Towns in Baden-Württemberg Category:Lörrach (district)
title: Todtnau
